posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I have 2 ideas: Cleric 26 / Monk 4 or Cleric 24 / Monk 3 / Rogue 3. Adding Monk lets you add your Wisdom bonus to your AC. The first option would be easier to roleplay, with only 2 classes, and it would give you a second Cleric bonus feat. The second option gives you Uncanny Dodge, which protects your Dexterity AC, and those nifty Rogue skills (but not until really late). One domain would of course be Healing. Let's let the other experts weigh in on what the other domain should be.

I would also add the possibility of Cleric Monk CoT for Great Wisdoms.

Other domain should be Travel for Haste. Hasted, you can cast / heal faster.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Jaquerez wrote:
Those seem like some very creative idea's I wouldn't have really thought a cleric and monk would go together well. xD
Welcome to the ECB, Jaquerez!

It's not only a very good combo, but one of the best if not the best combo in the game. Let's have a look at the synergy, shall we?

1- Clerics cast divine spells, which are modified by WISDOM. Monks add WISDOM to AC. That alone is a HELL of a synergy. You can pump your Wisdom to be a very efficient caster and that will also raise your AC!!! Now the synergy does NOT stop there! There is a ranged combat feat called Zen Archery, which uses Wisdom instead of Dexterity to modify ranged attack, and now your WISDOM effectively adds to your AB as well! That's what I call synergy!

2- Monks have a unique attack progression when fighting with a Kama or unarmed. They get up to 8 attacks per round if Hasted, 10 if Hasted and dual-wielding. Cleric spells buff AB and damage, so you'll deal A LOT of bonus damage on each attack and you'll have A LOT of attacks.

This means that a Wisdom-based Cleric will have more AB than a Fighter (thanks to Divine Power), a higher AC than any DEXer and will be able to cast high-DC spells while sniping with a proficiency that rivals AAs (although the damage doesn't).

A DEX-based Cleric / Monk (which wouldn't be your healer) will have a higher AB than a fighter, do more damage than most STR-builds thanks to the huge number of Attacks per Round and will dual-wield Kamas for a whopping 10 attacks per round while still having high AC. It's a thing of beauty!

One thing, though. That's not actually creative on our part. It's pretty common knowledge on the ECB. I would like to refer you to our Game Guides section where you can find all the knowledge you need to become an EPIC character builder!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey Jaquerez!

I second what Empyre said. In your original post, you requested a Healer. Zen Archery would be a good way to raise your AB SINCE YOU'RE ALREADY GOING FOR WISDOM TO HAVE MORE SPELLS PER DAY AND A BETTER HEAL SKILL (caps merely for emphasis). A Zen Archer doesn't do that much damage, but it's better than any non-AA dex-based archer because you have Divine Favor and they don't. Consider this. A Wizard who wants high-DC spells will need to invest points in INTELLIGENCE, but he doesn't have the option to pick a feat called "Smart Archery" to make his casting stat also increase his AB. You will pump your WISDOM to be a good caster and take Zen Archery to have another option for combat.

One of the most common mistakes of newer players is to want a build that does everything. That's not how it works. Everything in Neverwinter Nights is a tradeoff. Every point you put in Wisdom is a point that you don't put in Dexterity or Strength, or Charisma etc.. You get the point. Every feat you choose, is one less feat you have available to choose everything else. Resources are limited, so you need to prioritize. If you want a Battle Cleric, then your spells will probably not be as useful. If you want a Caster Cleric, your meleeing will be sub-par. Sorry, brother. You can't have it all, even moreso on a lvl 30 environment. So, Healer or Buffer? Which one do you want?

Take it EZ!

LOL, you're missing the point, brother. Zen Archery will give you good ranged AB because you're going for Wisdom (because you want a Healer, not a Battle Cleric). If you want to melee, then you would be a Battle Cleric, and either have to go for STR or DEX / just enough WIS to cast spells. You will be a healer (which is basically a CASTER toon who memorizes Heals, Stilled Heals, Mass Heals, Stilled Mass Heals, etc). This is your specialty. You can buff up with Divine Favors (all your level 1 spells should be Divine Favors and all your Level 2 spells should be Extended Divine Favors). That will allow you to conserve your spells for tougher fights. You can snipe the weak mobs and save your spells for tougher enemies. You should avoid meleeing at all costs and the best way to do that is to take Called Shot feat along with Zen Archery. I'll build you something later today so you can see what I mean.
